sentence.Network_en: Debilly had no Anglo-Saxon shyness about discussing money.
sentence.Network_cn: 在谈到钱时，德比利毫无英国式的羞涩。

entry.tran: 撒克逊人(早期为西日耳曼部落成员，后一些人定居在不列颠，被称为盎格鲁撒克逊人)
entry.def: In former times, Saxons were members of a West Germanic tribe. Some members of this tribe settled in Britain and were known as Anglo-Saxons .

entry.tran: 撒克逊人的;盎格鲁撒克逊人的;英国人的
entry.def: Something that is Saxon is related to or characteristic of the ancient Saxons, the Anglo-Saxons, or their descendants.

example.tran: 一座7世纪的撒克逊教堂

means.word_mean: 1. a member of a Germanic people who conquered England and merged with the Angles and Jutes to become Anglo-Saxons; dominant in England until the Norman conquest
1. of or relating to or characteristic of the early Saxons or Anglo-Saxons and their descendents (especially the English or Lowland Scots) and their language;

sentences.sentence: "for greater clarity choose a plain Saxon term instead of a latinate one"
